ARABIC: لَّا يُحِبُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْجَهْرَ بِٱلسُّوٓءِ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ إِلَّا مَن ظُلِمَ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ سَمِيعًا عَلِيمًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah does not like evil words being voiced out loud, except in the case of someone who has been wronged. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: God does not like ill (of others) spoken about, except by him who has been wronged. For God hears all and knows everything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah does not like speaking evil publicly unless one has been wronged. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God does not love public accusation unless one is truly wronged. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Allah does not like disclosure of evil matters except by the oppressed; and Allah is All Hearing, All Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Allah does not like that the evil should be uttered in public except by him who has been wronged. And Allah is Ever All-Hearer, All-Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah does not love the public utterance of hurtful speech unless (it be) by one to whom injustice has been done; and Allah is Hearing, Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: God likes not the shouting of evil words unless a man has been wronged; God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Allah loveth not the utterance of harsh speech save by one who hath been wronged. Allah is ever Hearer, Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God does not love the utterance of evil words except in the case of someone who has been wronged. God hears all and knows all.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah approveth not the publishment of evil speech, unless by one who hath been wronged; and Allah is ever Hearing, Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Allah does not like the disclosure of [anyone’s] evil [conduct] in speech except by someone who has been wronged, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Allah loveth not that evil should be noised abroad in public speech, except where injustice hath been done; for Allah is He who heareth and knoweth all things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah does not like that the evil should be uttered in public except by him who has been wronged. And Allah is Ever All-Hearer, All-Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Allah does not love the shouting of evil words, except by he who has been wronged. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: God does not like the public uttering of bad language, unless someone was wronged. God is Hearing and Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [4:148] God does not like the utterance of evil words out loud, by any person, that is to say, He will punish him for it, unless a person has been wronged, in which case He would not punish him for uttering it out loud, when he is informing [others] of the wrong done to him by the wrong-doer or summoning [them] against him. God is ever Hearer, of what is said, Knower, of what is done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Allah loveth not the utterance of harsh speech) verbal abuse (save by one who has been wronged) in this case, he is permitted to make supplications; it is also said that this means: Allah does not love the utterance of harsh speech even from one who has been wronged. (Allah is ever Hearer) of the supplication of the person who has been wronged, (Knower) of the punishment of the transgressor. This verse was revealed about Abu Bakr who was verbally abused by a man.
